---
title: "valid_metadata_v3.yaml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML file defines a configuration for feature flags and segments in a feature management system. It specifies a single feature flag with variants, rules, and metadata, as well as two user segments with their respective matching criteria.

## Symbols

### version
#### Description
Specifies the version of the configuration format.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| version | string | The version number of the configuration format |

### namespace
#### Description
Defines the namespace for the configuration.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| namespace | string | The namespace identifier |

### flags
#### Description
An array of feature flag definitions.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| flags | array | List of feature flag objects |

### flags[0]
#### Description
Defines a single feature flag named "flipt".

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the flag |
| name | string | Display name for the flag |
| description | string | Description of the flag's purpose |
| enabled | boolean | Whether the flag is enabled or not |
| variants | array | List of variant objects for the flag |
| rules | array | List of rule objects for the flag |
| metadata | object | Additional metadata for the flag |

### flags[0].variants
#### Description
Defines the variants for the "flipt" feature flag.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the variant |
| name | string | Display name for the variant |
| default | boolean | Whether the variant is the default (optional) |

### flags[0].rules
#### Description
Defines the rules for the "flipt" feature flag.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| segment | string | The segment key to which the rule applies |
| distributions | array | List of distribution objects for the rule |

### flags[0].metadata
#### Description
Provides additional metadata for the "flipt" feature flag.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| label | string | A label for the flag |
| area | integer | An area value associated with the flag |
| hidden | boolean | Whether the flag is hidden or not |
| radar | float | A radar value associated with the flag |

### segments
#### Description
An array of user segment definitions.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| segments | array | List of segment objects |

### segments[0]
#### Description
Defines the "all-users" segment.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the segment |
| name | string | Display name for the segment |
| description | string | Description of the segment's purpose |
| match_type | string | The type of matching to use for the segment |

### segments[1]
#### Description
Defines the "internal-users" segment with a constraint.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the segment |
| name | string | Display name for the segment |
| description | string | Description of the segment's purpose |
| constraints | array | List of constraint objects for the segment |
| match_type | string | The type of matching to use for the segment |

### segments[1].constraints[0]
#### Description
Defines a constraint for the "internal-users" segment.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| type | string | The type of comparison for the constraint |
| property | string | The property to evaluate |
| operator | string | The comparison operator |
| value | string | The value to compare against |

## Dependencies
This YAML file does not have any external dependencies. It is a self-contained configuration file.

## Configuration
The entire YAML file serves as a configuration for a feature management system. It defines feature flags, variants, rules, segments, and their associated properties.
